result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

9:39 AM Defendant Zenas M Ross in court.  Attorney Marshall Lemaster Belton in court for Zenas M Ross.  Attorney Robin Lee in court for State of Wisconsin.  Offer given, counter off from defense. Court will set for a scheduling conference.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Scheduling conference on November 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on September 23, 2022 at 09:30 am.
11:40 AM Attorney Marshall Lemaster Belton in court for Defendant Zenas M Ross. Prosecuting Atty Robin W Lee appeared for State of Wisconsin. Request for 2nd STC.
Motion for Discovery and Inspection- Defendant
Motion and Demand for Discovery and Notice of DNA and Witness List State of Wisconsin
Status conference on July 29, 2022 at 08:45 am.
Pre-trial conference on July 29, 2022 at 08:45 am.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.  
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Nicole W.  
Defendant has acknowledged and agreed to terms and conditions of bond. Defendant must return signed bond form within 10 days of today. Any bail money previously posted will not be returned until a signed bond form is on file with the Clerk of Courts.  
rial Judge - Br 13

10:17 AM Defendant appeared.  Lillian Rose Nelson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties by Zoom. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 08:45 am.
